cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.current_location: about 420 miles southwest of Fort Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast across the south-central Florida peninsula Saturday, then accelerating northeastward over the western Atlantic toward the open Atlantic south of Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southwest Florida coast near Naples/Fort Myers

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida south of the Volusia/Brevard County Line to Card Sound Bridge; west coast south of Middle of Longboat Key to Card Sound Bridge; Florida Keys, Florida Bay, Lake Okeechobee and parts of western Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area above (Tropical Storm Warning in effect there)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern and central Florida peninsula, Keys, northwestern Bahamas, and adjacent Atlantic waters; lesser effects possible along northeast Florida and Georgia coasts
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with sustained winds 20–30 mph and occasional gusts up to 35 mph possible late Saturday into Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the northeast Florida coast; guidance keeps peak surge 1–3 ft well south of Jacksonville.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Saturday evening through Sunday, locally higher in bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low tornado risk remains south of the port; minor coastal squalls could temporarily disrupt vessel scheduling.
